articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces battled Hamas fighters in the narrow alleyways of Jabalia in northern Gaza on Friday in some of the fiercest engagements since they returned to the area a week ago, while in the south militants attacked tanks massing around Rafah.
articles.title: Fierce fighting in northern Gaza as Israel defends itself at World Court

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's top commander warned on Friday of "heavy battles" looming on the war's new front in the northeastern Kharkiv region as Russian President Vladimir Putin said Moscow was carving out a "buffer zone" in the area.
articles.title: Ukraine braces for 'heavy battles' as Putin says Russia carving out Kharkiv buffer zone

articles.author: Ayhan Uyanik, Jan Lopatka
articles.description: Slovak doctors will meet on Monday to assess Prime Minister Robert Fico's health and discuss the possibility of transporting him from Banska Bystrica to the capital Bratislava, local media reported on Friday.
articles.title: Slovak doctors to discuss moving PM Fico to Bratislava on Monday, reports say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian guided bombs killed at least three people and injured 28 in the northeastern Ukraine city of Kharkiv on Friday, Mayor Ihor Terekhov said on Telegram.
articles.title: Russian guided bombs kill three, injure 28 in Ukraine's Kharkiv

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three foreign tourists and one Afghan citizen were killed by gunmen in Afghanistan's central Bamyan province on Friday, the interior ministry said.
articles.title: Gunmen kill three foreign tourists in Afghanistan's central Bamyan province

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: Reuters stringer Radovan Stoklasa was one of the few people left in a makeshift press centre in the Slovakian town of Handlova about 40 minutes after Prime Minister Robert Fico had briefed reporters on a cabinet meeting that had just ended. The sound of applause told him Fico was coming out onto the square below, but then he heard a noise that resembled firecrackers. Instinctively, he grabbed two cameras and pointed one out of the window, pressing the shutter release. Fico, Slovakia's dominant figure for two decades, had been shot and critically wounded, and security men were already bundling him into his limousine.
articles.title: The Slovak assassination attempt photo that nearly got away

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Aid deliveries began arriving at a U.S.-built pier off the Gaza Strip on Friday as Israel comes under growing global pressure to allow more supplies into the besieged coastal enclave, where it is at war with Palestinian militants Hamas and a famine looms.
articles.title: Aid begins to arrive in Gaza via US-built pier

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un oversaw the test of tactical ballistic missiles with new guidance technology on Friday, state media KCNA said on Saturday.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un oversaw missile test with new guidance system, KCNA says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Croatian parliament on Friday approved a government dominated by the conservative pro-European HDZ party, led by Prime Minister Andrej Plenkovic, marking his third term in the job following a parliamentary election last month.
articles.title: Croatia gets third government led by pro-EU PM Plenkovic

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France accused Azerbaijan on Friday of fanning the flames of riots in the French-ruled Pacific island of New Caledonia by flooding social media with what it said were misleading photos and videos targeting French police.
articles.title: France accuses Azerbaijan of meddling in New Caledonia with social media campaign
